{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3414910,"name":"","username":"kestrel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/67e7ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T18:10:47.367Z","cooked":"

I‚Äôve been looking at several cross-platform driver stations, namely QDriverStation and Conductor, and I thought it would be a fun project to try and make a basic one.

I‚Äôm wondering if anyone knows where (or how) the current DriverStation protocol can be found. I‚Äôve noticed both of them still have the 2020 protocol as ‚Äúin progress‚Äù, so I‚Äôm guessing it‚Äôs proprietary and a little hard to figure out? Any insight would be great!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T18:10:47.367Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":110,"reads":255,"readers_count":254,"score":601.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/looking-to-use-driverstation-app-with-a-esp32-based-personal-robot/498451/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Looking to use DriverStation app with a esp32 based personal robot","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55773,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8891 Software Student Lead"},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/1","custom_user_title":"8891 Software Student Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3414929,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T18:50:01.660Z","cooked":"

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T18:51:35.775Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":234,"readers_count":233,"score":91.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.wireshark.org/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Wireshark ¬∑ Go Deep","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414932,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T18:53:09.246Z","cooked":"

Official document can‚Äôt be found for safety reason.

This is because DS control a part of roboRIO, the part that you flashed into roborio via imaging tool which handles the enable and disable of the robot power output through FPGA. By requiring teams using official DS and image from NI, this ensure the robot can be safely disabled even if user code goes horriblely wrong. The most part of your user code on the robot is use WPILib to call API NI given to control IO and CAN output.

However, there‚Äôre serval effort to reverse engineer DS protocol. QDriverStation is one of it as you mentioned, OpenDS is one of them as well. Also Cheesy Arena implimented FMS protocol which allow it to control DS in competition. I personally have a python script, FakeDS to get robot enabled without the official DS (I have a project that I don‚Äôt need joystick, just need to get the output going).

DS protocol is not encrypted. You could easily look into it by using packet capture tool such as Wireshark or look into the source code of one of the project above. You would certainly need to know the how to with socket and some other stuff to get it working.

Using non official DS in competition is obvious not legal and not safe. If you‚Äôre doing this, please make sure to have other mean to have your robot disabled if you‚Äôre testing on a real robot (which I strongly not recommand to until you get your software finalized). As the ability for you to e-stop the robot could be limited.

Also speaking of QDriverStation, it can get the robot enabled but somehow joystick data is not working. And keep in mind that space bar e-stop is not working in QDriverStation if the window is not in focus.

sikaxn/fakeDS-Python: A python script which send Driver Station teleop enable packet to roboRIO","clicks":16},{"url":"https://boomaa23.github.io/open-ds/#dl-jar","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"OpenDS","clicks":11},{"url":"https://frc-utilities.github.io/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"QDriverStation","clicks":9},{"url":"https://github.com/Team254/cheesy-arena","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - Team254/cheesy-arena: An alternative field management system for the FIRST Robotics Competition.","clicks":6},{"url":"https://github.com/wpilibsuite/ni-libraries","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - wpilibsuite/ni-libraries: Houses the NI Libraries for WPILib building","clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/3","custom_user_title":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414945,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T19:17:45.466Z","cooked":"
NathanZhou:

Official document can‚Äôt be found for safety reason.

oooh buddy, you just triggered a few folks :).

I think we can agree that the DS is part of the ESTOP chain. Teams generally don‚Äôt get to put their own code into this safety critical channel, hence the requirement to use the standardized driver station, at least at events where FIRST has some liability.

The logic may also apply to your home shop space. But since you own the liability yourself, taking risks like a custom DS (which, presumably, is less trustworthy than the official one) might be acceptable.

However, I don‚Äôt think a safety based argument explains why documentation on the protocol can‚Äôt exist.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T19:19:51.878Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":160,"readers_count":159,"score":92.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414949,"name":"","username":"kestrel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/67e7ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T19:27:25.048Z","cooked":"

I totally get why FMS documentation can‚Äôt be found so people can‚Äôt use unofficial driver stations at competition, but I do wish the non-FMS driver station protocol could be found easily. And yes, I would absolutely not test this on a real robot without extensive testing with simulations and real robots up on blocks and an easily reachable breaker. I‚Äôll look into previous solutions and try to figure out what is going on with something like Wireshark or NetMon. Thanks!

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T19:27:25.048Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":145,"readers_count":144,"score":34.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55773,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8891 Software Student Lead"},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/5","custom_user_title":"8891 Software Student Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414952,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T19:33:14.019Z","cooked":"

If you look into the new FRP for control system FIRST post, it clearly says on part 4.1 that

These safety features must not be able to be easily disabled by the user and should be
‚Äúbuilt into‚Äù the modules in a secure manner.

So from my understanding, if you know the how-to, you could reverse engineer DS yourself, under your own risk, at your own shop, like mod/jailbreak a game console or iPhone. However they really don‚Äôt want people to poke into these. DS and the roboRIO image (which talks to DS and handle FPGA IO) is the part of control system that is closed source under proprietary software license term that they want to be secure. Thus no documents.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T19:35:10.044Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":37.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.firstinspires.org/sites/default/files/uploads/resource_library/frc/frc-ftc-RFP-2027-robot-controller.pdf","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":10}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24617,"username":"gerthworm","name":"Chris Gerth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/6","custom_user_title":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414958,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T19:43:48.906Z","cooked":"

edited for accuracy‚Ä¶

I don‚Äôt think I agree that documenting the robot communication protocol is causal with ‚Äúeasily disabled by the user‚Äù.

Safety needs to be ensured by proving the components in the system function within some acceptable probability of failure.

In the case of the current control system, it‚Äôs clearly not a valid assumption to say that ‚Äúby keeping it secret, we reduce the probability a student makes a component fail‚Äù.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T20:05:53.521Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":6,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":128,"readers_count":127,"score":40.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":3,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66330,"username":"NathanZhou","name":"Nathan Zhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414964,"name":"Nathan Zhou","username":"NathanZhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T20:00:35.845Z","cooked":"

Unfortunately it is that easy to disable. If you look into the FakeDS code I personally wrote my own, you would only need less than 10 line of code in a loop with only the default package python came with to get all the safety bypassed. Not to say I could bake this code to my robot code (I literally tried, see this roboRIO with nothing attached but RSL blinking) to cause more trouble.

I don‚Äôt want to keep this argument going but after all DS and roboRIO image is software under proprietary license terms so unfortunately NI and FIRST do whatever they want to do with it.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T20:03:56.368Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":115,"readers_count":114,"score":43.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Nathan Zhou","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://youtube.com/shorts/V219eEdhIRU?si=yDzF2J84xW6E3Kfj","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":5}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":24617,"username":"gerthworm","name":"Chris Gerth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":66330,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!"},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/8","custom_user_title":"Fennekinü¶ä is so cute!","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414967,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T20:07:11.381Z","cooked":"

Understood, and I edited above. I think we violently agree, at least up to saying secrecy does nothing for safety.

Which is why I made my point: there‚Äôs maybe some argument for keeping it secret, but safety can‚Äôt be a part of that argument.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T20:07:48.348Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":107,"readers_count":106,"score":26.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":66330,"username":"NathanZhou","name":"Nathan Zhou","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nathanzhou/{size}/225374_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/9","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414970,"name":"","username":"kestrel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/67e7ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T20:16:59.300Z","cooked":"

In a way doesn‚Äôt not documenting the protocol inherently make it more unsafe, since it is much easier to mess things up? I feel like anyone pursuing this will already understand that it is wildly important to be able to disable or estop the robot, but without proper documentation, they might not be able to.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T20:16:59.300Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":100,"readers_count":99,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55773,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"8891 Software Student Lead"},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/10","custom_user_title":"8891 Software Student Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3414991,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/268658_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T20:54:16.645Z","cooked":"
kestrel:

In a way doesn‚Äôt not documenting the protocol inherently make it more unsafe, since it is much easier to mess things up?

Formalizing requirements is a major part of designing a safe system. If you don‚Äôt know what parts you can change freely, and which parts are critical to overall safe functionality, you are indeed likely to make more mistakes while engineering the system.

kestrel:

feel like anyone pursuing this will already understand that it is wildly important to be able to disable or estop the robot,

Maybe. Here‚Äôs where I think FIRST gets unique. Any system their engineers design will be reviewed, reverse engineered, and replicated by thousands of the smartest people out there.

Unfortunately, a huge percentage of those smartest people have only been working on robots for a year or two. An intuitive understanding of how to write code in a way that keeps the system safe is not something I‚Äôd assume every team has.

Documentation is one step toward getting people to start thinking of the risks properly. Training would be good too.

Granted, currently, the number of folks actively trying to swap out parts of the control system related to that ESTOP safety chain is fairly small. I don‚Äôt expect that to change in the near future‚Ä¶ but if it does, docs/training or other mechanisms might be important.

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T20:54:16.645Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":10,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":98,"readers_count":97,"score":39.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415019,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T22:05:22.434Z","cooked":"
gerthworm:

Unfortunately, a huge percentage of those smartest people have only been working on robots for a year or two. An intuitive understanding of how to write code in a way that keeps the system safe is not something I‚Äôd assume every team has.

Documentation is one step toward getting people to start thinking of the risks properly.

Unfortunately, people don‚Äôt read the docs‚Ä¶ and inexperienced folks will happily skim over the safety warnings and risks to get to the ‚Äúfun stuff‚Äù. The OP in this thread I think is actually a perfect example of why the protocols are not publicly documented. The protocol is sufficiently simple that you can knock out basic enable operation in less than an hour, but with absolutely zero safety net. The hard (and un-fun) part is implementing it safely based on thinking through all the different failure modes of the hardware/software/network system.

If you‚Äôre looking for a ‚Äúfun project to try and make a basic [version of]‚Äù, a piece of software that can easily cause a 150 lb robot to crash uncontrolled into a person or a wall, with no way to quickly disable it, is the wrong type of project to pick. There are tons of great software projects in FRC that do not have this type of safety concern, or at the very least, have a well-tested additional layer of protection written by professional engineers (the DS).

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-08-12T22:05:22.434Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":82,"readers_count":81,"score":46.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":469773,"topic_slug":"driverstation-protocol","display_username":"Peter Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":13575,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/driverstation-protocol/469773/12","custom_user_title":"Volunteer WPILib Developer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3415024,"name":"","username":"kestrel","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/k/67e7ee/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-08-12T22:14:29.872Z","cooked":"

That‚Äôs fair actually. Personally, I‚Äôm doing this because I would like an actual functioning DriverStation that I can use for testing on Linux since the other ones are missing some pretty critical functionality.

I wouldn‚Äôt ever run this on a full-size robot without days of testing first, but I can definitely see how the protocol being clearly documented and accessible to someone just getting into robotics who hasn‚Äôt seen the damage these robots can do could lead to something going wildly wrong.

I wonder if it could be something where it would only be accessible to mentors and those mentors would have to give students access just to give an extra layer of protection. I get how that would be a pretty massive undertaking though

Peter_Johnson:

Unfortunately, people don‚Äôt read the docs

Totally agree.

DS protocol isn‚Äôt that complicated for folks who with the know how to get it. However with documentation published there will definitely be people without any idea about what they‚Äôre doing making run-away robots.
